abstract: New York City Education Dept reports number of students who qualified for gifted and talented programs rose in 2016, but says gap between performances of wealthier and poorer children persists; department also announces that gifted and talented programs would be implemented in four districts that do not currently have them.

headline.print_headline: Gifted Program to Grow Amid Disparities
headline.main: New York to Expand Gifted Offerings as Disparities Remain

snippet: The number of students who scored high enough to qualify for the programs rose this year, but there continues to be a divide between richer and poorer districts.
lead_paragraph: The number of students who scored high enough to qualify for the programs rose this year, but there continues to be a divide between richer and poorer districts.
